meanings.definition: To remove the helmet or head covering from.
meanings.sent1: He tried to dishelm the knight to see his face clearly.
meanings.sent2: The soldier had to dishelm before entering the castle.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squire accidentally tried to dishelm the king instead of bowing.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the warrior slowly began to dishelm, revealing his tired face.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell caused the helmet to dishelm itself, surprising everyone.

meanings.definition: To disarray or dishevel the hair or clothing of.
meanings.sent1: The wind gusts would dishelm her hair every time she stepped outside.
meanings.sent2: Running through the forest, the branches would dishelm his cloak.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved to dishelm his sister's neatly braided hair.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed to dishelm everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The playful puppy would always dishelm the blankets when jumping on the bed.
